member.name: T:BlackHen.Threading.WorkQueue
member.summary: Allows concurrent execution of work items.
member.remarks:
WorkQueue manages a queue of work that is to be performed. A is scheduled for execution by calling the method. If the is not reached, then the WorkItem is immediately executed on the . Otherwise it is placed in a holding queue and is executed when another WorkItem has completed.
The holding queue is prioritised. The WorkItem with the highest valued is the next item to execute.
The WorkQueue can be controlled with the , and methods. The event or the method can be used to determine when the last WorkItem has completed.
The , and events is used to monitor the specific stages of a work item. The event is used to monitor all transitions.
The event is raised when the throws an that is not related to the work item. After this event is raised the WorkQueue is in an inconsistent state and should not be used again.
